mechanics.condition: Creature or object is within the 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius
Exposed flame is within the 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius
Ground is within the 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius

mechanics.trigger: Creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn OR starts its turn there
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Dexterity saving throw

mechanics.trigger: Creature in the spell's area is concentrating
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC

description_text: Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused. The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls prone. If a creature is concentrating in the spell's area, the creature must make a successful constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or lose concentration.
